title.narrative: Programa de Rehabilitación de la Infraestructura de Transporte

description.narrative: Apoyar la recuperación de transporte por carretera de Jamaica mediante la rehabilitación de partes vitales de la red de carreteras primarias que han resultado dañadas debido a las tormentas, y ayudar consiguientemente a estimular la actividad económica y mejorar la calidad de la vida de la población jamaiquina.

To support the restoration of Jamaica's road transportation system through the rehabilitation of vital portions of the primary road network which have been damaged due to storms and to thereby help simulate economic activity and improve the quality of life of the Jamaican population.

activity-description.narrative: Rehabilitation of essential portions of the main road network through the construction of drains and other physical systems to ensure physical continuity thus minimizing the impact of future flooding on the road system.
Rehabilitation works completed along the Belmont to Ferris Main road
The aster Drainage Technical Studyaims at developing a series of procedures that will focus on flood control plans and speak to comprehensive drainage for specific flood zones across the island.

The general aim of the road restoration program is to improve the conditions of Jamaica's transportation system allowing the re-establishment of adequate operating conditions for small and medium size enterprises, including farmers, and thus assisting in stimulating economic activity and improving the quality of life in surrounding communities. Works done included drainage improvement, patching, milling and overlay, construction of retaining walls and construction and repair of sidewalks.

The major impact of the road rehabilitation at Cooper's Hill is to help decrease travel costs for road users which will in turn benefit access to social services and economic activities. This also helps to strengthen the National Works Agency (NWA) in improving the capacity to strategically address key reform issues towards improved road transport policy and regulations covering the Road Maintenace Management System (RMMS).

The major works included rehabilitation of several drains including the Gillings Gully and the roads that were directly over it. The major impact is a decrease in travel time for commuters and also a further reduction in transpostation costs due to improved road conditions and drainage.

This 8.5km section of the road network forms part of the larger 13km of roadway that was rehabilitated. The improvements of the road is expected to stimulate economic activities and improve the quality of life for the residents in the surrounding communities specifically the farmers.
This Bridge serves as the main access point for thousands of people commuting between Bull Bay, eastern Jamaica and the Corporate Area.

This section of the road development covers 6.5km of roadway. The major rehabilitation that was done was draining improvement, construction of retaining walls, patching, construction and repair of sidewalks and milling and overlaying.
